meanings.definition: A member of the armed forces ranking above a corporal.
meanings.sent1: The serjeants led the troops into battle.
meanings.sent2: The serjeants received medals for their bravery in combat.
meanings.sent3: The serjeants joked about their strict sergeant major.
meanings.sent4: The serjeants stood tall like guardians of the army.
meanings.sent5: The serjeants' uniforms gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A police officer of middle rank.
meanings.sent1: The serjeants patrolled the neighborhood to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: The serjeants investigated the crime scene thoroughly.
meanings.sent3: The serjeants shared a laugh during their break.
meanings.sent4: The serjeants' presence on the street was reassuring.
meanings.sent5: The serjeants swiftly responded to the emergency call.

meanings.sent1: The serjeants assisted the noble guests at the banquet.
meanings.sent2: The serjeants carried out their duties with precision.
meanings.sent3: The serjeants playfully teased each other while working.
meanings.sent4: The serjeants' loyalty to their master was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The serjeants' swift movements impressed everyone.
